subject: RE: [junit] HotSpot Virtual Machine Error.
msgSnippet: This sort of thing is usually indicative of a JVM bug, which usually means you should upgrade your JVM/JDK to the latest patch release for your major version.

This sort of thing is usually indicative of a JVM bug, which usually means
you should upgrade your JVM/JDK to the latest patch release for your major
version.  If you're on Sun 1.3.1 line, definitely upgrade to 1.3.1_06.

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vikas Malla [mailto:malla6um@...]
>
>
> I use ant task <batchtest> to run a series of tests for my
> application. Off late, I have been getting the following error
> that causes my tests to fail, that is, this error is generated
> during the execution of my tests. A typical scenario is that
> first 6 test run fine, and the seventh test has this problem
> which makes the test to fail. And all the following tests fail as well.
>
> [java] #
>
> [java] # HotSpot Virtual Machine Error, Internal Error
>
> [java] # Please report this error at
>
> [java] # http://java.sun.com/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi
>
> [java] #
>
> [java] # Error ID: 47454E45524154452F4F502D41500E4350500842
>
> [java] #
>
> [java] # Problematic Thread: prio=5 tid=0x8a44e68 nid=0x6c0 runnable
